english_test_tasks.description: Read the following sentences and choose the correct answer to complete each sentence.

english_test_questions.content: I don’t mind ____________________a cat in my house so long as it doesn’t smell.
Let’s go and have a cup of coffee. We have ______time before the train leaves.
The house was empty for a month __________________ my neighbors moved out.
Scientists have advanced many theories about why human beings cry tears, but none of _____________has been proved.
If you add three and two, you ______ five.
Eventually you’ll ___________________ the smells in the laboratory.
Your apartment is old and small. You would like to live in a nice big apartment. You say: I wish I ____________ in a nice big apartment.
During her stay in Mongolia, Susan tried almost all the local foods her friends ______.
The boys ________________________by the police on their way home.
Direct speech: “I’m waiting for my English exam result,” Chimgee said. Reported speech: Chimgee said (that)____________________.
english_test_questions.answer: she was waiting for her English exam result
choices: she is waiting for my English exam result
she has been waiting for her English exam result
she waited for her English exam result
she was waiting for her English exam result
she was waiting for my English exam result

english_test_questions.content: The recipe tells you to use a pound and a _______________________ butter.
Yesterday, Lisa went to the hairdresser’s. She_________________________ .
If he ________________too much, he wouldn’t have felt sick.
We live in _____village _____ their parents.
I took a vest with me ___________________________I wouldn’t get cold.

english_test_tasks.description: Identify the underlined part that should be corrected in each sentence.

english_test_questions.content:
Most candles are
    made
of paraffin wax
    mix
with compounds
    that
have a higher melting point
    to keep
them from
    melting
in hot weather.

More
pigs
    are raised
in Lowa
    than
    in
    >other any
state.

english_test_sections.title: SECTION 2 VOCABULARY
english_test_sections.description: Read the sentences and choose the correct word to complete each sentence.

english_test_questions.content: _____________Jim nor Tom passed the exam.
The more he looked at her, _______________________________embarrassed she was.
John is ____________________________and needs help when asked to sign papers.
We must get a ____________of flour, and some eggs and apples, so we can make an apple pie for dessert.
Children_________their necks to see who their mother was talking to.
Teaching English in a lively interesting way increases students’ ___________to learn.
Regular exercise is good for your body and brain. It _______your blood with oxygen.
My ______________is that you’re not getting enough work done.
The heavy rain flooded the field, and the ground was muddy. Under these _______the kids couldn’t play.
The two countries have ____________close ties for centuries.

english_test_sections.title: Phrasal Verbs
english_test_sections.description: Complete the phrasal verbs with the correct particles.

english_test_questions.content: Because of some mistakes in my test, my teacher made me do it _____________.
It’s getting late, I’m turning _________.
Chimgee is nearly eight feet tall and has red hair, so she really sticks______ in a crowd.

english_test_sections.title: Idioms
english_test_sections.description: Choose the correct meaning of the underlined idioms.

english_test_questions.content: Jake and I lost our jobs yesterday. Now we are in the same boat.
english_test_questions.answer: They are in the same bad situation.
choices: They are in the broken boat.
They are in the same bad situation.
They are looking for a job.

english_test_questions.content: Chimgee got it in the neck because she forgot to turn off the car light last night.
english_test_questions.answer: She was punished for the damage to the car battery.
choices: The long drive hurt her neck.
She was punished for the damage to the car battery.
She forgot to turn off the car light.
Her shirt was open at the neck.
She was punished for the damage to the car light.

english_test_questions.content: My girlfriend always acts as if she were born yesterday.
english_test_questions.answer: She is naive because she doesn’t have much experience in life.
choices: Her boyfriend doesn’t know what she really wants.
She believes that the best way to learn is by experience.
She is naive because she doesn’t have much experience in life.

english_test_sections.title: SECTION 3 COMMUNICATION
english_test_sections.description: Read the conversations and choose the best answers.

english_test_questions.content:
Man: Does Judy prefer saving her money?
Woman: ______________________ She loves to buy things.
choices: Yes, she always saves her money.
No, she wouldn’t rather spend her money.
Yes, she prefers saving her money.

english_test_questions.content:
Girl: I really must be going now.
Boy: But you’ve just come. Wouldn’t you like to stay for a snack?
Girl: That’s very kind of you, but I mustn’t be too late.
Boy: _______________ Girl: Thanks very much for the party.

Student: Did people there use to be poor?
Teacher: _________________ They used to be rich.

english_test_tasks.title: Reading Comprehension
english_test_tasks.description: Read the short conversations and choose the best answers.

english_test_questions.content:
Man: How did Fred manage to pass his social psychology class?
Woman: It is a mystery to me.
What does the woman mean?
choices: Fred’s social psychology class is mysterious.
Social psychology class is interesting to the woman.

english_test_questions.content:
Woman: It’s dark in the front hall.
Man: The bulb’s burned out.
What does the woman imply?
choices: The ball is in the front hall.
The woman has to light a candle.

english_test_sections.title: SECTION 4 READING
english_test_sections.description: Read the passage and choose the correct answers.

english_test_tasks.content:
(1) When John was growing up, other kids felt sorry for him because his parents always made him weed the garden, carry out the garbage and deliver newspapers. But when John reached adulthood, he was better than his childhood playmates. He had more job satisfaction, a better marriage, and was healthier. Most of all, he was happier. Far happier.

(2) The findings of a 40-year study that observed the lives of 456 teenage boys from Boston showed that those who had worked during their boyhood enjoyed happier and more productive lives than those who had not. "Boys who worked in the home or community gained more competence and came to feel themselves as worthwhile members of society", said George Vaillant, the psychologist who made the discovery. As he also said, "Because they felt good about themselves, others felt good about them as well."

(3) Vaillant’s study observed these males in great detail. Interviews were repeated at the ages of 25, 31 and 47. Under Vaillant’s supervision, the researchers compared the men’s mental health scores with their boyhood-activity scores. Points were awarded for their part-time jobs, housework, school efforts, and ability to deal with problems.

(4) The link between the scores of men’s boyhood and adulthood activities was surprisingly sharp. Those who had done the most boyhood activities were twice as likely to have warm relations with a wide variety of people, five times as likely to be well paid, and 16 times less likely to have been unemployed. The researchers also found that IQ, family, and social and economic status made no real difference in how the boys turned out to be adults.

(5) Working at any age is important. Childhood activities help children develop their abilities to be responsible, independent, confident and competent—the underpinnings of emotional health. They also help them understand the importance of cooperative work toward common goals. The most confident adults are those who know how to do this. Yet work isn’t everything. As Tolstoy once said, "One can live magnificently in this world if he/she knows how to work and love, and how to work for the person one loves and love one’s work."

english_test_questions.content: What do we know about John?
english_test_questions.answer: He enjoyed his career and marriage.
choices: He received little love from his family.
He enjoyed his career and marriage.
He was envied by others in his childhood.
He felt sorry for his childhood.

english_test_questions.title: Reading Comprehension
english_test_questions.description: Read the passage and choose the correct answers.

english_test_questions.content: Vaillant’s words in Paragraph 2 serve as___________.
english_test_questions.answer: an explanation of why some boys grew into happy men
choices: an explanation of why some boys grew into happy men
a description of personal values and social values
analysis of how work was related to competence
an example of parents’ expectations of their children
advice on how to become a worthy member of society

english_test_questions.content: Vaillant’s team obtained their findings by___________.
choices: recording the boys’ effort in school

english_test_questions.content: The word “sharp” in paragraph 4 is closest in meaning to:
What can be inferred from the last paragraph?
english_test_questions.answer: Emotional health is essential to wonderful adult life.
choices: Competent adults know more about love than work.
Love brings more joy to people than work does.
Emotional health is essential to wonderful adult life.
Independence is the key to one’s success.
Confident adults know more about work than love.

english_test_questions.content: The word “They” in paragraph 5 refers to:

english_test_sections.title: Matching Exercise
english_test_sections.description: Combine each phrase in column "A" with a suitable phrase from column "B". Not all phrases in column "B" will be used.

english_test_sections.title: Word Definitions
english_test_sections.description: Match the words with their definitions. There are two extra definitions.

english_test_match_questions.matcher: someone who goes to live in a new place
a son of someone’s stepmother or stepfather
become more developed mentally and emotionally and behave in a responsible way
someone who illegally and intentionally kills another person

english_test_sections.title: Word Forms
english_test_sections.description: Choose the correct word form that best fits in each blank.

english_test_task_multiple_blank.description: Fill in the blanks with the correct word form
english_test_task_multiple_blank.content: About 5000 years ago, China lost much of its wood because of overpopulation and poor (a) ____ of its forests. This (b) _____ was very bad for their country, of course, but it turned out to be very good for the food. Wood became very expensive and (c) ______ to get, so the Chinese had to either find a substitute for their valuable wood or learn how to use it better. In order to (d) ______ in cooking, they had to use very little wood. So they started cutting their meat and vegetables into small pieces before they put them in the hot oil. That way, the food (e)________ in this manner kept its fresh (f) _________. This flavor attracts people to the art of Chinese (g) _________. I often wonder if the Chinese (h) ________ their solution to that ancient energy crisis as much as I do now- whenever I eat Chinese food.
